title.narrative: F.a: UGACO office PMER support for the Country Programme

description.narrative: In order to improve programme quality, it is of essence to have presence in the country. Working with the local partners successfully requires working hand in hand through the project cycle. The field presence is in line with FCA’s regional strategy, and supporting the strategic goals especially related to programme quality, capacity building, advocacy, programme development, thematic/technical support and broadening the funding base.The overall objective is to improve effectiveness, quality and impact of the FCA country programme focusing on the thematic areas, Right to Livelihood, Right to Education and Right to Peace through established field presence.Expected results:The country programme is effective in delivering quality programming in line with the country programme annual plan.The following activities will be undertaken towards achieving these results:• Strategic and operational planning for the country • Programme and project PME and administrative support• Planning, monitoring of country pro gramme and projects: offer technical support and ensure quality program delivery• Building the capacity of local partners • Identification and selection of new partners • Networking at country level • Broadening the access to funding opportunities • Coordination of work and cooperation with other aid organisations • Ensuring increased input of partner organisations and topics from the region into the lobby and advocacy work.The above activities will lead to improved programme delivery by the imp lementing partners, quality reporting and financial management as well as increased visibility of FCA and MFA’s supported work in Uganda.Implementing partner:FINN CHURCH AID, Uganda Country OfficePartners:Local and regional civil society actors, internat ional organisations, donors
